org.opends.server.types

Class AttributeBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.opends.server.types.AttributeBuilder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<AttributeValue>

    @PublicAPI(stability=UNCOMMITTED,
           mayInstantiate=true,
           mayExtend=false,
           mayInvoke=true)
public final class AttributeBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable<AttributeValue>
    This class provides an interface for creating new non-virtual Attributes, or "real" attributes.

    An attribute can be created incrementally using either AttributeBuilder(AttributeType) or AttributeBuilder(AttributeType, String). The caller is then free to add new options using setOption(String) and new values using add(AttributeValue) or addAll(Collection). Once all the options and values have been added, the attribute can be retrieved using the toAttribute() method.

    A real attribute can also be created based on the values taken from another attribute using the AttributeBuilder(Attribute) constructor. The caller is then free to modify the values within the attribute before retrieving the updated attribute using the toAttribute() method.

    The Attributes class contains convenience factory methods, e.g. Attributes.empty(String) for creating empty attributes, and Attributes.create(String, String) for creating single-valued attributes.

    AttributeBuilders can be re-used. Once an AttributeBuilder has been converted to an Attribute using toAttribute(), its state is reset so that its attribute type, user-provided name, options, and values are all undefined: 

     AttributeBuilder builder = new AttributeBuilder();
 for (int i = 0; i < 10; i++)
 {
   builder.setAttributeType("myAttribute" + i);
   builder.setOption("an-option");
   builder.add("a value");
   Attribute attribute = builder.toAttribute();
   // Do something with attribute...
 }

    Implementation Note: this class is optimized for the common case where there is only a single value. By doing so, we avoid using unnecessary storage space and also performing any unnecessary normalization. In addition, this class is optimized for the common cases where there are zero or one attribute type options.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AttributeBuilder

        public AttributeBuilder()
        Creates a new attribute builder with an undefined attribute type and user-provided name. The attribute type, and optionally the user-provided name, must be defined using setAttributeType(AttributeType) before the attribute builder can be converted to an Attribute. Failure to do so will yield an IllegalStateException.

      • AttributeBuilder

        public AttributeBuilder(Attribute attribute)
        Creates a new attribute builder from an existing attribute.

        Modifications to the attribute builder will not impact the provided attribute.

        Parameters:
        attribute - The attribute to be copied.

      • AttributeBuilder

        public AttributeBuilder(Attribute attribute,
                boolean omitValues)
        Creates a new attribute builder from an existing attribute, optionally omitting the values contained in the provided attribute.

        Modifications to the attribute builder will not impact the provided attribute.

        Parameters:
        attribute - The attribute to be copied.
        omitValues - true if the values should be omitted.

      • AttributeBuilder

        public AttributeBuilder(AttributeType attributeType)
        Creates a new attribute builder with the specified type and no options and no values.
        Parameters:
        attributeType - The attribute type for this attribute builder.

      • AttributeBuilder

                java.lang.String name)

        Parameters:
        attributeType - The attribute type for this attribute builder.
        name - The user-provided name for this attribute builder.

      • AttributeBuilder

        public AttributeBuilder(java.lang.String attributeName)
        Creates a new attribute builder with the specified attribute name and no options and no values.

        If the attribute name cannot be found in the schema, a new attribute type is created using the default attribute syntax.

        Parameters:
        attributeName - The attribute name for this attribute builder.

        public java.util.Iterator<AttributeValue> iterator()
        Returns an iterator over the attribute values in this attribute builder. The attribute values are returned in the order in which they were added to this attribute builder. The returned iterator supports attribute value removals via its remove method.

      • setAttributeType

        public void setAttributeType(java.lang.String attributeName)

        If the attribute name cannot be found in the schema, a new attribute type is created using the default attribute syntax.

        Parameters:
        attributeName - The attribute name for this attribute builder.

      • setInitialCapacity

        public AttributeBuilder setInitialCapacity(int initialCapacity)
                                    throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Sets the initial capacity of this attribute builders internal set of attribute values.

        The initial capacity of an attribute builder defaults to one. Applications should override this default if the attribute being built is expected to contain many values.

        This method should only be called before any attribute values have been added to this attribute builder. If it is called afterwards an IllegalStateException will be thrown.

        Parameters:
        initialCapacity - The initial capacity of this attribute builder.
        Returns:
        This attribute builder.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If this attribute builder already contains attribute values.

      • setOption

        public boolean setOption(java.lang.String option)
        Adds the specified option to this attribute builder if it is not already present.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        true if this attribute builder did not already contain the specified option.

      • setOptions

        public boolean setOptions(java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> options)
        Adds the specified options to this attribute builder if they are not already present.
        Parameters:
        options - The options to be added to this attribute builder.
        Returns:
        true if this attribute builder was modified.

      • optionsEqual

        public boolean optionsEqual(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> options)
        Indicates whether this attribute builder has exactly the specified set of options. This implementation returns AbstractCollection.isEmpty() if the provided set of options is null. Otherwise it checks that the size of the provided set of options is equal to the size of this attribute builder options, returns false if the sizes differ. If the sizes are the same then each option in the provided set is checked and if all the provided options are present true is returned.
        Parameters:
        options - The set of options for which to make the determination (may be null).
        Returns:
        true if this attribute builder has exactly the specified set of options.

      • size

        public int size()
        Returns the number of attribute values in this attribute builder.
        Returns:
        The number of attribute values in this attribute builder.

      • toAttribute

        public Attribute toAttribute()
                      throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Returns an attribute representing the content of this attribute builder.

        For efficiency purposes this method resets the content of this attribute builder so that it no longer contains any options or values and its attribute type is null.

        Returns:
        An attribute representing the content of this attribute builder.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If this attribute builder has an undefined attribute type or name.
